definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: We see corruption smothering entrepreneurship and good governance.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到腐败扼杀了创业精神和良治。

sentences.english: I guess entrepreneurship is in my blood.
sentences.chinese: 我想我的创业精神是与生俱来的。

sentences.english: The most enterprising individuals on earth still clamour to come to America.
sentences.chinese: 全球最富有创业精神的个体挤破头脑都想进美国。

sentences.english: But it can kill the spirit of an entrepreneur to spend too much time in a big company.
sentences.chinese: 在是在一个大公司淫浸太久会抹杀你的创业精神。

sentences.english: Why the emphasis on manual labor and entrepreneurship?
sentences.chinese: 为什么强调手工劳动和创业精神？

sentences.english: They have demonstrated both entrepreneurship and drive to succeed, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，这些人表明他们具有创业精神和成功的动力。

sentences.english: Entrepreneurial mindsets are exploiting new business niches and are driving the recovery.
sentences.chinese: 创业精神正在开发新的商业机遇，并推动经济的复苏。

sentences.english: Study entrepreneurship, but major in something else.
sentences.chinese: 学习创业精神，但同时要做到术业有专攻。

sentences.english: And innovation and entrepreneurship in particular have the potential to be the great equalizer.
sentences.chinese: 创新和创业精神尤其有潜力成为巨大的平衡力量。

definition: to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
to begin an undertaking/to start a major task/to initiate/to venture/venture/entrepreneurship
firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to develop/to make full use of
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
